p: Fidelis et al. [ 97] studied the essential oil obtained from the leaves of rosewood ( Aniba rosaeodora Ducke), from plants of different ages, as a potential, more sustainable, alternative to extraction from the chipped wood. The chemical profile of the leaf oil samples from plants of different ages was similar and was examined by GCÃ—GC, enabling a three-fold increase in the number of compounds reported than a conventional separation.
